trajectories.question:
Get the stats of the top 5 trace ids (from mdc.trace_id field of the splunk logs) from the splunk logs for services with names starting with 'bot-svc-llm' prefix, with index=globaldefault and check for any '504 Gateway Timeout' error pattern in those services from 10:00 to 10:05 yesterday (UTC time).
- Then get the list of Top SQL, SOQL and LLM queries in terms of longest duration and the avg duration of the SQL, SOQL and LLM queries related to these splunk logs by analyzing their trace ids.

steps.llm_response: We need yesterday's UTC date to build absolute Splunk time bounds, then query Splunk for the target logs, extract top 5 trace_ids, and analyze each trace for SQL/SOQL/LLM details.

steps.llm_response: We need to run a Splunk query to get the top 5 trace IDs by count for services starting with 'bot-svc-llm' that have '504 Gateway Timeout' between 10:00 and 10:05 UTC yesterday (already computed as 09/14/2025). Then analyze each trace ID for SQL, SOQL, and LLM details.
steps.action_input: {'query': 'index=globaldefault service_name="bot-svc-llm*" "504 Gateway Timeout" earliest="09/14/2025:10:00:00" latest="09/14/2025:10:05:00" | stats count by mdc.trace_id | sort -count | head 5 | fields mdc.trace_id'}

trajectories.question: For all the mission critical services (which names starting with 'bot-svc-llm' prefix), get their gus product tags  (from the gusProductTagId field in their service definition) and from that the list of gus investigations created for those services in the last 10 days. Finally output the list of gus investigation ids (ids usually in format 'W-<numbers>')

steps.llm_response: First, list services with names containing 'bot-svc-llm'. Then, for each service whose name starts with that prefix, fetch its service definition to extract gusProductTagId. Finally, query GUS investigations for each product tag over the last 10 days and collect W-ids.

[{"Name": "W-19635279", "Id": "a07EE00002LjmnDYAR", "Subject": "Standard - 471469517 - Clifford Law Offices P.C. (Reseller) - LLM truncating the responses after analysing the files in prompt template.", "Description": "Impact Information Original Severity Level: 2 Multiple cases from different customers?: No Previously working functionality STOPPED working?: No Over 50% of users on Production (non-Sandbox) are blocked without any workaround?: No It's preventing an upcoming deployment, release, or milestone?: Yes(on 2025-09-17 07:23:00 UTC) Signature Severity 1 Case in OrgCS with CIC engaged?: No Red Account?: No Executive Involved?: No Access/Operation Restricted Environment: None 
 Issue The customer is using the Flex Prompt Template for file analysis, the file has 100+ invoice line items. Even though the file is within limits, 1.3 MB and 70 Pages, the response still does not contain all the line items from the file. 
 
 Actual Result The response only shows certain line item details, such as up to 10-11. However, some other line items are still valid in the PDF. 
 
 Expected Result As the PDF has multiple pages with multiple line items, each valid line item must be included in the line items. As per the documentation below, 
 File Upload Limits Most models support at least one file type that can be used with prompt templates. These file limits apply across all models: Maximum quantity: 10 images or 100 PDF pages per request Maximum file size: 3.5MB per image or 15MB per PDF per request Gateway limit: 15MB The uploaded file is 1.5 MB with 70 Pages. https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?language=en_US&id=ai.prompt_builder_limits.htm&type=5 
 Troubleshooting With the Google Gemini 2.5, we are receiving below error: 
 An error occurred during generation. Model provider error: Request timed out waiting for response from provider. If the issue persists, contact Salesforce Customer Support and ask for help with error GatewaySystem Error. 
 Hence, we have reached out in the below slack channel and got to know that we have a timeout of 175 sec in Google Gemini, and Gemini is not responding within that timeout. link="https://salesforce-internal.slack.com/archives/C04M12AQZM2/p1756706894287209?thread_ts=1756686033.299949&cid=C04M12AQZM2"https://salesforce-internal.slack.com/archives/C04M12AQZM2/p1756706894287209?thread_ts=1756686033.299949&cid=C04M12AQZM2 
 We suggested that the customer use an advanced Gemini model like Google Gemini 2.5 Flash , which they did and could see an improvement in their response. The output shows more than 80 line items. However, there is an issue with the Open AI model: OpenAI GPT 4 Omni Mini The customer's main concern is with the model is it supports files up to 15MB but why it doen't return all the line items. We could below error intermittently: 'actions': [ { 'id': '22479;a', 'state': 'SUCCESS', 'returnValue': { 'generationErrors': [ { 'errorMessage': '//api.salesforce.com/ai/gpt/v1/chat/generations\': Read timed out', 'httpErrorCode': '500', 'localizedErrorMessage': '//api.salesforce.com/ai/gpt/v1/chat/generations\': Read timed out', 'messageCode': 'GatewaySystemError' } ], 
 We do not see any exception in SCRT2: link="https://splunk-web-noncore.log-analytics.monitoring.aws-esvc1-useast2.aws.sfdc.is/en-US/app/search/search?earliest=-60m%40m&latest=now&q=search%20%60indexes_for_tenant(agentforce)%60%20%2000000000000000007d8cdc2bbf076dd5%20earliest%3D09%2F12%2F2025%3A05%3A33%3A00%20latest%3D09%2F12%2F2025%3A05%3A37%3A00&display.page.search.mode=verbose&dispatch.sample_ratio=1&display.prefs.events.offset=50&sid=1757657946.18819_BD608338-234D-4B58-BC8C-A6FC5FBAD76A"https://splunk-web-noncore.log-analytics.monitoring.aws-esvc1-useast2.aws.sfdc.is/en-US/app/search/search?earlies[…]8338-234D-4B58-BC8C-A6FC5FBAD76A In CORE: link="https://splunk-web.log-analytics.monitoring.aws-esvc1-useast2.aws.sfdc.is/en-GB/app/search/search?earliest=-60m%40m&latest=now&q=search%20index%3DNA235%2000DHr00000CCeKl%201448565000000bbaff%20earliest%3D09%2F12%2F2025%3A05%3A33%3A00%20latest%3D09%2F12%2F2025%3A05%3A37%3A00&display.page.search.mode=verbose&dispatch.sample_ratio=1&sid=1757658120.129783_0C54944B-262F-4450-A8F1-3B9A0604E6AC"https://splunk-web.log-analytics.monitoring.aws-esvc1-useast2.aws.sfdc.is/en-GB/app/search/search?earliest=-6[…]0C54944B-262F-4450-A8F1-3B9A0604E6AC It shows : Thrown: lib. gack.GackContext: org.springframework.web.client.ResourceAccessException: I/O error on POST request for ' link="https://api.salesforce.com/ai/gpt/v1/chat/generations"https://api.salesforce.com/ai/gpt/v1/chat/generations ': Read timed out

 Issue The customer is using the Flex Prompt Template for file analysis, the file has 100+ invoice line items. Even though the file is within limits, 1.3 MB and 70 Pages, the response still does not contain all the line items from the file. 
 
 Actual Result The response only shows certain line item details, such as up to 10-11. However, some other line items are still valid in the PDF. 
 
 Expected Result As the PDF has multiple pages with multiple line items, each valid line item must be included in the line items. As per the documentation below, 
 File Upload Limits Most models support at least one file type that can be used with prompt templates. These file limits apply across all models: Maximum quantity: 10 images or 100 PDF pages per request Maximum file size: 3.5MB per image or 15MB per PDF per request Gateway limit: 15MB The uploaded file is 1.5 MB with 70 Pages. https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?language=en_US&id=ai.prompt_builder_limits.htm&type=5 
 Troubleshooting With the Google Gemini 2.5, we are receiving below error: 
 An error occurred during generation. Model provider error: Request timed out waiting for response from provider. If the issue persists, contact Salesforce Customer Support and ask for help with error GatewaySystem Error.

 We suggested that the customer use an advanced Gemini model like Google Gemini 2.5 Flash , which they did and could see an improvement in their response. The output shows more than 80 line items. However, there is an issue with the Open AI model: OpenAI GPT 4 Omni Mini The customer's main concern is with the model is it supports files up to 15MB but why it doen't return all the line items.  Actual Result The response only shows certain line item details, such as up to 10-11. However, some other line items are still valid in the PDF. 
 
 Expected Result As the PDF has multiple pages with multiple line items, each valid line item must be included in the line items. As per the documentation below, 
 File Upload Limits Most models support at least one file type that can be used with prompt templates. These file limits apply across all models: Maximum quantity: 10 images or 100 PDF pages per request Maximum file size: 3.5MB per image or 15MB per PDF per request Gateway limit: 15MB The uploaded file is 1.5 MB with 70 Pages. https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?language=en_US&id=ai.prompt_builder_limits.htm&type=5

Red Account?: Please mark the Red Account button as 'True' Salesforce Executive Involved?: VP and above Context (mandatory) Document the concern or request for which the engineering team should review Specify whether this is related to: design, performance, deployment, etc Differentiate the actual result and your expected result, if this differs from what the customer is asking for Highlight the use case being attempted Clarify the difference between the customers expectations and the actual behavior of the component Check the documentation to confirm that the usage of the product/feature is correct. Provide links to it Share a description about the symptoms. Provide details on the parameters/configurations that were modified during the troubleshooting phase. This will speed up the troubleshooting downstream. Share a link to the swarm discussions. Reproducibility (mandatory) Recreate the flow logic in a simple application to understand if the issue can be recreated outside of the customer environment. Share a note if the issue reproduction is impacted due to lack of credentials. Is this consistently reproducible? If not, share more details on network related configuration and related details Network topology Stale connection eviction policies Usage of VPC's Usage of onprem services - DB, messaging, etc If there are multiple customers facing this issue, is there a pattern in the servers/endpoints being used by those customers? Environment Details (mandatory) Specify the version of the connector/modules used Have they been updated to the most recent version? Identify if there are challenges to use the most recent version Is the issue reproducible in a supported version? Latest version Or previous major if still supported (latest [minor.patch]) Did the issue appear on a specific version? What is their deployment model? RTF/CH1.0/CH2.0/on-prem Runtime version Java version Third party libs - which lib and version? Is the app deployed in a clustered environment? Is FIPS enabled Is the connector connecting to failover/load balanced url? Connection type: does it happen for one or multiple types - OAuth, Basic, JWT, etc Runtime properties: are any properties used by the app (related to streaming, buffer size..) What type of Object Store the app is using? - OSv2, Local, Persistent, non-persistent? What is the Cloudhub worker size (for performance/hung issues). Specify the server version and OS where the issue is reproducible Is this issue reproducible in any specific OS like Windows/mac/Linux? Can customers share their server (Ex SFTP, MQ) credentials to reproduce? Can the issue be experienced outside of mule application. If the customer is using Anypoint PCE, please provide the following details: PCE Version of the environment. If PCE version is 3.x or lower, attach a `gravity report` tarball output and `gravity status` output. If PCE version is 4.x or higher, attach a `pcectl report` tarball output. What was the recent operation performed on the cluster? For e.g. Install, Upgrade, Backup-Restore, Node OS updates etc. Debugging artifacts (mandatory) Debug/trace logs Use the x-request-id to track the failure in splunk using the search criteria index=mulesoft 'x-request-id'. Use the exact time range in the har file and ensure to account for the timezone From the above search we may need to look for errors in dependent services like exchange, core services using the x-request-id or using the kubernetes traceId or the spanId Heap dump for out of memory issues Threads stack dump for deadlock issues Collect the network archive and identify the failing transaction. If you are able to narrow down the failure, search existing cases and KB for the same. Review the KB and collect all the required information. Include links to KB when available. Enable the debug logs as per the instructions in KB for the failing component/module Simple application with the flow logic to understand if the issue can be recreated outside of the customer environment. Scenario based (mandatory) For connection related concerns like breakage or instability, is the application recovering? If the issue is due to load specify the no of requests being sent in per-sec/per-min. For file/data related issues (like Amazon S3 put) specify file size in KB/MB.

 Actual Result The response only shows certain line item details, such as up to 10-11. However, some other line items are still valid in the PDF. 
 
 Expected Result As the PDF has multiple pages with multiple line items, each valid line item must be included in the line items. As per the documentation below, 
 File Upload Limits Most models support at least one file type that can be used with prompt templates. These file limits apply across all models: Maximum quantity: 10 images or 100 PDF pages per request Maximum file size: 3.5MB per image or 15MB per PDF per request Gateway limit: 15MB The uploaded file is 1.5 MB with 70 Pages. https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?language=en_US&id=ai.prompt_builder_limits.htm&type=5

If you are able to narrow down the failure, search existing cases and KB for the same. Review the KB and collect all the required information. Include links to KB when available. Enable the debug logs as per the instructions in KB for the failing component/module Simple application with the flow logic to understand if the issue can be recreated outside of the customer environment. Scenario based (mandatory) For connection related concerns like breakage or instability, is the application recovering? If the issue is due to load specify the no of requests being sent in per-sec/per-min. For file/data related issues (like Amazon S3 put) specify file size in KB/MB.
